DOC.criteria: 1 . Pregnant woman 16 week , 0 day 21 week , 6 day ' gestation 2 . Maternal age ≥18 year age 3 . Subject sign dated Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) approve consent form participate study 4 . Subjects study must high risk preterm birth indicate least one following : A previous delivery live bear singleton 20 week , 0 day 36 week , 6 day due spontaneous preterm premature labor preterm rupture fetal membrane Short cervical length ( ≤25 mm ) determine transvaginal ultrasound Current twin pregnancy Cervical cerclage prior pregnancy Prior cone biopsy Prior LEEP / LLETZ 1 . Maternal age 18 2 . Suspected proven rupture fetal membrane time specimen collection 3 . Known significant congenital structural chromosomal fetal anomaly 4 . Women moderate gross bleeding evident speculum examination 5 . Women sexual intercourse within 24 hour prior specimen collection 6 . Cervical cerclage time specimen collection 7 . Current triplet ( ) pregnancy 8 . Placenta previa active bleeding
